summary: This is an email chain from August 14, 2019, regarding preparations for a visit to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) by officials from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG). The email discusses the tour agenda, which includes viewing the Special Housing Unit (SHU), meeting with investigative teams, and presenting the unique operational challenges of the MCC.

persons.name: Mr.
persons.context: The email sender states that 'Mr.' has advised them and they are prepared for the officials' arrival, indicating he is a staff member or advisor involved in the MCC visit preparations.

events.title: OAG/ODAG Visit to MCC
events.description: Officials from the Office of the Attorney General and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General are scheduled to visit the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) to tour the facility, including the Special Housing Unit (SHU), and meet with the After Action Team and Suicide Reconstruction Team.

keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, and discusses a visit scheduled for August 15, 2019.
The visit involves officials from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).
The agenda includes a tour of the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and meetings with the After Action Team and Suicide Reconstruction Team.
The purpose is to show the unique operations and challenges of the MCC compared to other facilities.
The context suggests this visit is related to an ongoing investigation or review, likely following Jeffrey Epstein's death at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
